column4: does noone here know how to install the sl-modem-daemon or how to have ubuntu search for new hardware >?
iirc all smp-enabled kernels have trouble with slmodem (ask google, i might confuse it with ltmodem) . so you'd need the -386 kernel or boot with the nosmp boot argument

Since there is restricted code involved the slmodem may just not be available for 64-bit. Crossreading over some forum postes there is no out of the box support on 64 bit, so you'd have to try to compile that yourself
